summary: The National Human Trafficking Database Act mandates the establishment of a national database within the Department of Justice to collect and analyze human trafficking data. The bill authorizes grants to state agencies to collect and report relevant data, including arrests, prosecutions, and organization information, while mandating survivor confidentiality. The Director of the Office for Victims of Crime will compile data from state agencies and federal agencies, publishing it online and reporting to Congress annually. The bill authorizes appropriations for grant management and database maintenance.
